questions.text: Who among these went back to school?
questions.explanation:
Sam.

	He wanted to get his diploma. He was one credit short so he decided to return to school.

questions.text: What did the gang think Sam was doing?
questions.explanation:
drinking.

	Sam was a recovering alcoholic. Because he didn't tell them he was going back to school they thought he was drinking again.

questions.text: What schooling was the bar's student doing?
questions.explanation:
high school.

	Sam went back to school to get his high school diploma. Diane thought he was going to college and was disappointed she dated a high school drop out.

questions.text: Who did Norm say never finished high school?
questions.explanation:
Cher.

	Cher had dyslexia. She always knew she'd be an actress one day.

questions.text: Who else decided to finish school?
questions.explanation:
Coach.

	Coach also had not finished high school. Sam going back gave him the courage to do the same thing.

questions.text: What class did the two students take?
questions.explanation:
Geography.

	Coach had an interesting way of learning geography. He memorized the facts by setting them to music.

questions.text: Who was getting good grades by sleeping with the teacher?
questions.explanation:
Sam.

	Coach was working very hard to get As but Sam got them by sleeping with the teacher. When Coach found out, he was furious.

Miss Perdy.

	Miss Perdy was never seen on the show, only talked about. When Sam refused to sleep with her anymore, she laughed (according to what Sam said) when he said he'd pass the test on his own.

questions.text: Complete this line: "Albania, Albania you border on the __________"?
questions.explanation:
Adriatic.

	This was one of the songs that Coach came up with to memorize his geography facts. At first Sam thought it was stupid but then agreed to try it.

questions.text: What did Diane say was the capital of North Dakota?
questions.explanation:
Pierre.

	Pierre is actually the capital of South Dakota. Sam couldn't believe Diane didn't know that and told the rest of the bar.
